text.p: Nigerian journalist Mohammed Adamu was detained by security agents on Sunday after writing a recent article critical of military ruler General Sani Abacha's security chief, colleagues said.
The colleagues said Adamu was picked up by three security men from his house in a suburb of the capital Abuja at about 3.20 p.m. (1420 GMT).
"They said they had come from the presidency," one colleague said.

In the July 14 edition of Concord magazine, one of several publications owned by detained presidential claimant Moshood Abiola, Adamu wrote an article under the title "(Hamza) Mustapha - ruthless man behind Abacha".
Mustapha is the head of security at the presidency.

Nigeria holds dozens of political prisoners -- a major sticking point in relations with Western countries, which accuse the military government of human rights abuses and insincerity in its plan to restore civilian rule in 1998.
